headline: Nuclear Sector Earnings Show a Mixed Picture. Why One Stock Is Surging.
summary: Nuclear energy has been one of the hottest areas of the stock market this year, with the VanEck Uranium and Nuclear exchange-traded fund up 40%.  BWX Technologies  a Virginia-based nuclear technology company, blew away analysts’ earnings expectations late on Monday, and its stock soared 17% Tuesday.  The company, which makes parts for reactors, has contracts with the Navy to build equipment for things like nuclear submarines.

headline: CEG's Q2 Earnings Coming Up: How Should Investors Play the Stock?
summary: Constellation Energy's Q2 earnings are likely to have gained from rising data center demand, robust nuclear infrastructure and its focus on renewable expansion.

headline: Constellation Energy Corporation Declares Dividend
summary: BALTIMORE, August 05, 2025--The Board of Directors of Constellation Energy Corporation (Nasdaq: CEG) declared a quarterly dividend of $0.3878 per share on Constellation’s common stock. The dividend is payable on Sept. 5, 2025, to shareholders of record as of 5 p.m. Eastern time on Aug. 18, 2025.

headline: CEG vs. AEP: Which Utility Is Best Positioned for Long-Term Growth? (Revised)
summary: U.S. utility operators, CEG and AEP have the potential to grow even further and provide service efficiently.
